definition: to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Intercession is the chief means appointed by God to bring the great redemption within the reach of all.
sentences.chinese: 而代禱則是神所定規將救贖帶給所有的人的主要途徑。

sentences.english: For the Lord, the Lord of armies, is about to make destruction complete in all the land.
sentences.chinese: 因爲主萬軍之耶和華在全地之中必成就所定規的結局。

sentences.english: "The problem is that conforming to noraptms is an easy and safe spot to be in, " Bellezza told The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 問題在於，遵守定規是一種簡單而安全的做法。

sentences.english: That's much easier said than done, because the process of change is random.
sentences.chinese: 這說起來容易做起來難，因爲變化的過程是無定規的。

sentences.english: So far, no method has been found which would make it possible to invent hypotheses by rule.
sentences.chinese: 迄今爲止，還沒有找出方法，能夠按定規創造假說。

definition: to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
honorific (e.g. in grammar of oriental languages)
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
